properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally significant rainfall amounts possible... An area of low pressure will continue to bring scattered showers, heavy at times, and isolated thundershowers to northeastern mainland Nova Scotia and Cape Breton Island today. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 30 mm are possible in the heaviest showers by Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-01T10:16:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T07:44:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2103358452.2019
Area: Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Another hot day today with temperatures currently peaking above 30 C at Carmacks and Beaver Creek. Cooler weather will return on Monday with highs in the low to mid twenties. Heat warnings are issued when daytime highs are forecast to reach at least 28 C for two consecutive days and the overnight low doesn't fall below 13 C. ### To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-01T10:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-30T23:06:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2856220212.2019
Area: Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall possible today and tonight. Rain currently affecting the southwest coast of Newfoundland will spread eastward along the coast throughout the day today. We are generally expecting to see between 20 and 40 mm by Tuesday morning. However, due to some isolated pockets of heavier rain, totals could reach as high as 60 mm over some areas. It should be more clear later today which areas, if any, will be affected by heavier rain. Until then, the public is advised to be prepared for heavy downpours, especially with regards to travel or outdoor activities for Canada Day. Rain is expected to taper to showers and drizzle by Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-07-01T16:17:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T08:18:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0748233842.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Clarenville and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms in the region are expected to continue tonight. Some of these thunderstorms could become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-01T10:36:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T04:38:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0704614437.2019
Area: Peawanuck, Webequie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:22 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of severe thunderstorms stretching from 140 km west of Moosonee to 110 km north-northwest of Hearst moving at 40 km/h southeast. These storms are capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T10:21:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T07:23:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0970757983.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A severe thunderstorms located 120 km northwest of Fraserdale moving at 60 km/h to the northeast. The thunderstorm is capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T08:27:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4162994238.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain, heavy at times, will continue over Victoria County today and tonight. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 40 mm are expected by Tuesday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-01T23:40:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T07:41:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0276153326.2019
Area: Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada
